data.title: The 16 Craziest Players In The NBA
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Rasheed Wallace made his return to the NBA this weekend triumphantly coming off the bench in garbage time and hitting a three-pointer.

Sheed became the definition of the "crazy athlete" a decade ago — combining on-court petulance, outlandish statements, and off-court issues to turn himself into a household name.

Advertisement

Now the league is full of these types of guys.

This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

We picked out our 16 favorites, and included one great anecdote about each of them.

Advertisement

Rasheed Wallace

Team: New York Knicks

Crazy anecdote: He once got 41 technicals in a season, and he said yesterday, "My speed isn't the same. My agility isn't the same, but I can still talk."

Advertisement

Delonte West

Team: Unemployed

Crazy anecdote: Arrested for having a shotgun in a guitar case slung over his back while driving a three-wheeled motorcycle.

Advertisement

Enes Kanter

Team: Utah Jazz

Crazy anecdote: Claimed he lost 51 pounds in two months during the offseason.

Advertisement

Metta World Peace

Team: Los Angeles Lakers

Crazy anecdote: He was once at a pickup basketball game in Queensbridge where a fellow player was stabbed with a wooden table leg and killed.

Advertisement

Ivan Johnson

Team: Atlanta Hawks

Crazy anecdote: He was "banned for life" from the Korean Basketball League for making an obscene gesture at a ref.

Advertisement

Darko Milicic

Team: Boston Celtics

Crazy anecdote: He doesn't have a bank account, and said, "I just keep it," when asked when he does with his money.

Advertisement

DeShawn Stevenson

Team: Atlanta Hawks

Crazy anecdote: He has a tattoo of Abe Lincoln on his Adam's apple. He thinks he's better than LeBron James. He got arrested for public intoxication after the NBA Finals. Take your pick.

Advertisement

J.R. Smith

Team: New York Knicks

Crazy anecdote: Sports Illustrated's Lee Jenkins tweeted this once, "Once interviewed JR Smith for pre-season story and stupidly asked how his summer went. 'All right,' he said. 'Got out of jail'"

Advertisement

Amir Johnson

Team: Toronto Raptors

Crazy anecdote: Dressed up as a zombie for a Zombie Walk in Toronto. He also follows the most "booty models" of any NBA player on Twitter.

Advertisement

Michael Beasley

Team: Phoenix Suns

Crazy anecdote: He was fined $50,000 for smoking weed at the NBA's rookie symposium. And also went to rehab once.

Advertisement

Kevin Garnett

Team: Boston Celtics

Crazy anecdote: He completely ignored his teammate of five years when they faced each other for the first time as opponents.

Advertisement

Javale McGee

Team: Denver Nuggets

Crazy anecdote: Once ran down the other end of the court while the rest of his team was on offense for no apparent reason. He also invited his Twitter followers to lunch and no one showed up.

Advertisement

DeMarcus Cousins

Team: Sacramento Kings

Crazy anecdote: He was sent home from the team by coach Paul Westphal a week into the season. Then he demanded a trade. And then Westphal was fired... So Cousins basically got his coach fired.

Advertisement

Joakim Noah

Team: Chicago Bulls

Crazy anecdote quote: "I played dirty? OK. I'm just trying to win basketball games, man. It's the name of the game."

Advertisement

Andrew Bynum

Team: Philadelphia 76ers

Crazy anecdote: He got benched after he went on a three-point shooting kick for no discernible reason last season.

Advertisement

Andray Blatche

Team: Brooklyn Nets

Crazy anecdote: He complained about his role in the offense earlier this year. And by "earlier" we mean immediately after the first game of the season.

Advertisement
